Robert Hofstadter

Dates

February 5, 1915 – November 17, 1990

Hofstadter, Robert, 1915-1990

Additional Forms of Names

Hofstadter, R. (Robert), 1915-1990

Biography

Abstract

Robert Hofstadter was Emeritus Professor of Physics at Stanford University (1950-1990). Other institutional affiliations include Princeton University and Norden Laboratory Corporation. His research interests included the structure of nucleons and gamma rays.

February 5, 1915Birth, New York (N.Y.).

1935Obtained BS, College of the City of New York, New York (N.Y.).

1938Obtained MA and PhD Physics, Princeton University, Princeton (N.J.).

1938 – 1939Procter Fellow, Princeton University, Princeton (N.J.).

1939 – 1941Harrison Fellow (1939-1940) and Instructor in Physics (1940-1941), University of Pennsylvania.

1941 – 1942Instructor, College of the City of New York.

1942 – 1943Physicist, National Bureau of Standards.

1943 – 1946Physicist and Section Chief, Norden Laboratory Corporation.

1946 – 1950Assistant Professor of Physics, Princeton University, Princeton (N.J.).

1950 – 1990Associate Professor to Professor of Physics (1950-1971); Max H. Stein Professor of Physics (1971-1985); and Emeritus Professor of Physics (1985-1990), Stanford University, Stanford (Calif.).

1958Member, National Academy of Sciences.

1961Awarded Nobel Prize in Physics "for his pioneering studies of electron scattering in atomic nuclei and for his thereby achieved discoveries concerning the structure of the nucleons".

1972 – 1980Consultant on laser fusion, KMS Fusion.

1986Awarded National Medal of Science.

November 17, 1990Death, Stanford (Calif.).
